issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I am developing an app with the geolocation services and there is no problem with iOS, however when I try to test it on Android, a location error occurs.

[ERROR] :  GeolocationModule: (main) [39266,89619] Unable to get current position, location is null

I am using SDK 7.5.0GA and Android Samsung Galaxy S7 (8.0)

comments.body:
Hi [~pravsrivastava], please try to build your project with latest ti sdk 8.0.0.GA which can be downloaded with the command: appc ti sdk install latest
Let us know if you still experience the same in latest builds.
Thanks!

{{getCurrentLocation}} returns a cached location. If you have not monitored for location yet you will not get a location. Use Ti.Gelocation {{location}} event to start monitoring for the location.

See docs: https://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/api/Titanium.Geolocation-event-location

Also, include {{ti.playservices}} module to enable better geolocation support
Hello [~pravsrivastava], did you followed Rene's guide above? let us know how things going.

Hello,
Did you able to find this issue resolved ? Let us know the current status of your issue whether the provided workaround was helpful or not.Â
